member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.ParagraphCount.NumberFormat
member.summary: Specifies a numbering sequence. The defined values are: -1: Hindu-Arabic number sequence starts with 1. -a: number sequence of lowercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “a”. -A: number sequence of uppercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “A”. -i: number sequence of lowercase Roman numerals starts with “i”. -I: number sequence of uppercase Roman numerals start with “I”. -a value of type string 18.2. -an empty string: no number sequence displayed. If no value is given, no number sequence is displayed.

member.summary: Contains number of paragraphs.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.FontRelief
member.summary: Specifies whether a font should be embossed, engraved, or neither. The defined values are: -embossed: characters are embossed. -engraved: characters are engraved. -none: characters are neither embossed or engraved.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.UnderlineType
member.summary: Specifies the type of underlining applied to a text. The defined values are: -double: a double line should be used for underlining applied to a text. -none: deprecated. -single: a single line should be used for underlining applied to a text.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.UnderlineStyle
member.summary: Specifies a style for underlining text. The defined values are: -none: text has no underlining. -dash: text has a dashed line underlining it. -dot-dash: text has a line whose repeating pattern is a dot followed by a dash underlining it. -dot-dot-dash: text has a line whose repeating pattern is two dots followed by a dash underlining it. -dotted: text has a dotted line underlining it. -long-dash: text has a dashed line whose dashes are longer than the ones from the dashed line for value dash underlining it. -solid: text has a solid line underlining it. -wave: text has a wavy line underlining it.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.UnderlineWordMode
member.summary: Specifies whether underlining is applied to words only or to portions of text. If underlining is applied to text portions, the spaces between words and the words are underlined. The defined values are: -continuous: underlining is applied to words and separating spaces. -skip-white-space: underlining is not applied to spaces between words.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.UnderlineWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of an underline. The value bold specifies a line width that is calculated from the font sizes like an auto width, but is wider than an auto width. The defined values are: -auto: the width of an underline should be calculated from the font size of the text where the underline will appear. -bold: the width of an underline should be calculated from the font size of the text where the underline will appear but is wider than for the value of auto. -a value of type percent -a value of type positive integer -a value of type positive length

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.UnderlineColor
member.summary: Specifies a color that is used to underline text. The value of this attribute is either font-color or a color. The defined values are: -font-color: the current text color is used for underlining. -a value of type color: the color to be used for underlining.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.LineThroughWordMode
member.summary: Specifies whether lining through is applied to words only or to portions of text. The defined values are: -continuous: lining is applied to words and separating spaces. -skip-white-space: lining is not applied to spaces between words.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.EnableLetterKerning
member.summary: Specifies whether kerning between characters is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.EnableTextBlinking
member.summary: Specifies whether text blinks.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.TextCombine
member.summary: Specifies whether to combine characters so that they are displayed within two lines. The defined values are: -letters: Display text in Kumimoji. Up to five (5) characters are combined within two lines and are displayed with a reduced size in a single wide-cell character. Additional characters are displayed as normal text. -lines: Displays text in Warichu. All characters with the style:text-combine attribute that immediately follow each other are displayed within two lines of approximately the same length. A line break may occur between any two characters to meet this constraint. -none: characters should not be combined.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.TextCombineStartChar
member.summary: Specifies the start character that is displayed before a portion of text

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.TextCombineEndChar
member.summary: Specifies the end character that is displayed after a portion of text

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.TextRotationAngle
member.summary: Specifies an angle to which text is rotated.If more than one character is selected, the entire selection is rotated as a block. The defined values for are: -0 degrees -90 degrees -270 degrees -an angle. The value shall be one of 0deg, 90deg or 270deg, or any of its equivalents in rad or grad.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.TextProperties.TextRotationScale
member.summary: Specifies whether for rotated text the width of the text should be scaled to fit into the current line height or the width of the text should remain fixed, therefore changing the current line height. The defined values for are: -fixed: width of text should remain fixed. -line-height: width of text should be scaled to fit the current line height.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.PageVariableGetField.NumberFormat
member.summary: Specifies a numbering sequence. The defined values are: -1: Hindu-Arabic number sequence starts with 1. -a: number sequence of lowercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “a”. -A: number sequence of uppercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “A”. -i: number sequence of lowercase Roman numerals starts with “i”. -I: number sequence of uppercase Roman numerals start with “I”. -a value of type string 18.2. -an empty string: no number sequence displayed. If no value is given, no number sequence is displayed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.PageVariableGetField.EnableLetterSynchronization
member.summary: Specifies whether letter synchronization shall take place. If letters are used in alphabetical order for numbering, there are two ways to process overflows within a digit, as follows: -false: A new digit is inserted that always has the same value as the following digit. The numbering sequence (for lower case numberings) in that case is a, b, c, ..., z, aa, bb, cc, ..., zz, aaa, ..., and so on. -true: A new digit is inserted. Its start value is ”a” or ”A”, and it is incremented every time an overflow occurs in the following digit. The numbering sequence (for lower case numberings) in that case is a,b,c, ..., z, aa, ab, ac, ...,az, ba, ..., and so on.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.PageVariableGetField.Value
member.summary: Contains page variable.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration
member.summary: Represents a values for each note class used in a document. If there is no note configuration element, an implementation defined default note configuration is used.

member.name: M:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the NotesConfiguration class.

member.name: M:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new object that is a deep copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

member.name: M:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of the current NotesConfiguration object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.NoteClass
member.summary: Contains a class of a note.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.CitationStyle
member.summary: Contains a text style to use for a note citation within the footnote.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.CitationBodyStyle
member.summary: Contains a text style to use for a note citation in the text flow.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.DefaultNoteParagraphStyle
member.summary: Contains a default footnote paragraph style for new footnotes that are inserted into an existing document. It is not evaluated for footnotes that already exist.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.MasterPage
member.summary: Contains the name of a master page.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.StartValue
member.summary: Contains the value at which note numbering starts.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.NumberFormat
member.summary: Contains a numbering sequence. The defined values for the attribute are: -1: Hindu-Arabic number sequence starts with 1. -a: number sequence of lowercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “a”. -A: number sequence of uppercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “A”. -i: number sequence of lowercase Roman numerals starts with “i”. -I: number sequence of uppercase Roman numerals start with “I”. -a value of type string 18.2. -an empty string: no number sequence displayed. If no value is given, no number sequence is displayed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.FootnotesPosition
member.summary: Specifies if footnote numbers start with a new number at the beginning of the document or at the beginning of each chapter or page. The defined values for the text:start-numbering-at attribute are: -chapter: footnote numbers start with a new number at the beginning of a chapter. -document: footnote numbers start with a new number at the beginning of a document. -page: footnote numbers start with a new number at the beginning of a page.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.NoteContinuationNoticeForward
member.summary: Specifies the text that is displayed at the end of a footnote that is continued on the next page

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.NotesConfiguration.NoteContinuationNoticeBackward
member.summary: Specifies the text that is displayed before continued text.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.SortKey.SortAscending
member.summary: Specifies whether locale specific sorting takes pace in ascending or descending order. The defined values are: -false: sorting takes place in descending order. -true: sorting takes place in ascending order. The default value for this attribute is true.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.TableCount.NumberFormat
member.summary: Specifies a numbering sequence. The defined values for the style:num-format attribute are: -1: Hindu-Arabic number sequence starts with 1. -a: number sequence of lowercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “a”. -A: number sequence of uppercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “A”. -i: number sequence of lowercase Roman numerals starts with “i”. -I: number sequence of uppercase Roman numerals start with “I”. -a value of type string 18.2. -an empty string: no number sequence displayed. If no value is given, no number sequence is displayed.

member.summary: Specifies the format of an index entry.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.IndexOfIllustrationsSource.IndexTitleTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the style and content of the index title.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.IndexOfIllustrationsSource.UseCaption
member.summary: Specifies whether the captions or names of illustrations or tables are used for an index. The defined values are: -false: illustration or table names are used for an index. -true: illustration or table captions are used for an index. The default value for this attribute is true.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.IndexOfIllustrationsSource.CaptionSequenceName
member.summary: Contains the sequence by which captions are identified.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.IndexOfIllustrationsSource.CaptionSequenceFormat
member.summary: Contains the format of entries for the index of illustrations obtained from the image captions. The defined values are: -caption: text of the caption in which the referenced sequence field is included (without sequence number and value). -category-and-value: displays the name and value of the referenced sequence field. -text: displays the value of the referenced sequence field.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.IndexOfIllustrationsSource.IndexScope
member.summary: Specifies whether an index is constructed for an entire document or for a chapter. The defined values are: -chapter: the index is constructed for the chapter that contains the index. A chapter consists of all those paragraphs and headings which have the same immediately preceding heading with outline level 1. -document: the index is constructed for the entire document. The default value for this attribute is document.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.IndexOfIllustrationsSource.IsRelativeTabStopPosition
member.summary: Specifies whether the position of tab stops is relative to the left margin or to the left indent as determined by the paragraph style The defined values are: -false: paragraph style does not determine position of tab stops relative to the left margin or left ident. -true: paragraph style determines the position of tab stops relative to the left margin or left ident.

member.summary: Contains an identifier for a control element.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.Action
member.summary: Locates a remote resource.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.TargetFrame
member.summary: Specifies a target frame. The defined values are: -_blank: The referenced document is displayed in a new frame. -_parent: The referenced document is displayed in the parent frame of the current frame. -_self: The referenced document replaces the content of the current frame. -_top: The referenced document is displayed in the topmost frame, that is the frame that contains the current frame as a child or descendant but is not contained within another frame. -A frame name : The referenced document is displayed in the named frame. If the named frame does not exist, a new frame with that name is created. The default value for this attribute is _blank.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.Method
member.summary: Specifies the HTTP method used to submit data in a form to a server. The defined values are: -get: HTTP get method. -post: HTTP post method. -a value of type string These values are not case sensitive. The default value for this attribute is get.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.EncodingType
member.summary: Specifies the content type used to submit the form to the server.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.AllowDeletes
member.summary: Specifies whether data records can be deleted by a form. It applies only if a form is data-aware.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.AllowInserts
member.summary: Specifies whether new data records can be inserted by a form. It applies only if the form is data-aware.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.AllowUpdates
member.summary: Specifies whether data records in the form can be updated. It applies only if the form is data-aware.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.ApplyFilter
member.summary: Specifies whether the filter clause is applied to the SQL command constituting the form's result set.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.CommandType
member.summary: Specifies the type of command to execute on a data source. The defined values of the form:command-type attribute are: -command: the command contains an SQL statement. The form executes the SQL statement. -query: the command contains the name of query. The form retrieves and executes the query. -table: the command contains a table name. The form retrieves all of the data in the table. The default value for this attribute is command.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.Command
member.summary: Contains a command to execute on a data source.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.DataSource
member.summary: Specifies the name of a data source to use for a form. The defined values are: -A IRI specifying a database connection. -A data source name that an consumer can use to establish database connections. -The URL of an OpenDocument database front-end document.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.MasterFields
member.summary: Contains a names of the columns in the result set represented by a parent form.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.DetailFields
member.summary: Specifies the names of the columns in contained forms that are related to columns in the containing form.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.EscapeProcessing
member.summary: Specifies whether the consumer processes the command before passing it to a database driver.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.Filter
member.summary: Contains a filter.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.IgnoreResult
member.summary: Specifies whether to discard all results that are retrieved from an underlying data source.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.NavigationMode
member.summary: Specifies methods for navigation of a database aware form. The defined values : -current: An user interface is provided and the navigation is performed on the current form. -none: a dedicated user interface is not provided, but the form may be navigated using the TAB and SHIFT/TAB keys on the keyboard. -parent: a user interface is provided and the navigation is performed on the parent form of the current form.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.Order
member.summary: Contains a sort criteria for a command.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.TabCycle
member.summary: Specifies how the consumer responds when the user presses the TAB key in the controls in a form. The behavior of the consumer depends on whether the form is bound to a data source. The defined valuesare: -current: If a user presses the TAB key in the last control of the form, the focus moves to the first control specified in the tab order of the same form. If the form is data aware, then the current row of the result set subject to the form is not changed. -page: If a user presses the TAB key in the last control of a form, the focus moves to the first control specified in the tab order for the next form. -records: If a user presses the TAB key in the last control of the form, the focus moves to the first control specified in the tab order of the same form. If the form is data aware, then the current row of the result set subject to the form moves to the next row.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Form.ConnectionResource
member.summary: Specifies a source database.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.CheckBox.ImagePosition
member.summary: Specifies the location of an image relative to the text of a control. The defined values are: - bottom: image is placed below the text. - center: image centered relative to the text. - end: image is placed after the text. - start: image is placed before the text. - top: image is placed above the text. The default value for this attribute is center.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.CheckBox.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Specifies which border (start, end) or axis (center) of an image and a text are to be aligned. The defined values are: -center: image and text are centered. -end: image and text are aligned on the end of the image. -start: image and text are aligned on the start of the image. If a form:image-align attribute is not present, it is assumed to be center. The default value for this attribute is center.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AnimationType
member.summary: Specifies the type of animation that is used for a text. The defined values are: - alternate: scrolls the text from one side to another and back. - none: disables the text animation. - scroll: scrolls the text from one side to another. - slide: scrolls the text from one side to the original text position and stops there.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AnimationDirection
member.summary: Specifies the scroll direction of animated text. The defined values for the text:animation-direction attribute are: - down: animated text scrolls down. - left: animated text scrolls left. - right: animated text scrolls right. - up: animated text scrolls up.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.StartAnimationInside
member.summary: Specifies if a text animation starts inside or outside a shape.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.StopAnimationInside
member.summary: Specifies if a text animation stops inside or outside a shape.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AnimationRepeat
member.summary: Specifies the number of times an animation is repeated. If the value of the attribute is 0, the animation is repeated indefinitely.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AnimationDelay
member.summary: Specifies a delay before an animation is started.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AnimationSteps
member.summary: Specifies the distance by which text is moved within a scrolling step.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AutoGrowWidth
member.summary: Specifies whether to automatically increase the width of the drawing object if text is added to the drawing object.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AutoGrowHeight
member.summary: Specifies whether to automatically increase the height of the drawing object if text is added to the drawing object.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.FitToSize
member.summary: Specifies whether to stretch the text content of a drawing object to fill an entire object.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.FitToContour
member.summary: Specifies whether to stretch the text content of a drawing object to fill the contour of an object.

member.summary: Specifies the horizontal alignment of the text area inside a shape.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.TextAreaVerticalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the vertical alignment of the text area inside a shape.

member.summary: Specifies whether the clipped text is visible or hidden.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.ColorMode
member.summary: Specifies the output of colors from a source bitmap or raster graphic. The defined values for the draw:color-mode attribute are: - greyscale: image is displayed using intensity only. - mono: image is displayed in black and white. - standard: image is displayed without modification by the draw:color-mode attribute. - watermark: colors are modified to make the resulting image transparent.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.EnableColorInversion
member.summary: Specifies whether the colors in the graphic shape should be inverted.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AdjustLuminance
member.summary: Specifies a signed percentage value that sets the output luminance of a bitmap or raster graphic.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AdjustContrast
member.summary: Specifies a signed percentage value that sets the output contrast of a bitmap or raster graphic.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AdjustGamma
member.summary: Specifies a value that sets the output gamma of a bitmap or raster graphic.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AdjustRed
member.summary: Specifies a non destructive filter for a linear transformation of the white balance of a pixel image.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AdjustGreen
member.summary: Specifies a non destructive filter for a linear transformation of the white balance of a pixel image.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.AdjustBlue
member.summary: Specifies a non destructive filter for a linear transformation of the white balance of a pixel image.

member.summary: Specifies the opacity of an image.

member.summary: Specifies the enables or disables a three-dimensional shadow for a three-dimensional object.

member.summary: Used to render a shadow.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.ShadowOffsetY
member.summary: Used to render a shadow.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.ShadowColor
member.summary: Specifies the color in which a shadow is rendered.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.ShadowOpacity
member.summary: Specifies the opacity in which the shadow is rendered. The value of this attribute is a percentage value.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.StartLineSpacingHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies the length of the escape line from the start shape for standard connectors.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.StartLineSpacingVertical
member.summary: Specifies the length of the escape line from the start shape for standard connectors.

member.summary: Specifies an increments the length of the escape line from the end shape.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.EndLineSpacingVertical
member.summary: Specifies an increments the length of the escape line from the end shape.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.LineDistance
member.summary: Specifies the distance between a reference line (as defined by the reference points) and a dimension line.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.GuideOverhang
member.summary: Specifies the length of extension lines after their intersection with a dimension line.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.GuideDistance
member.summary: Specifies the distance between the reference points and the start point of extension lines.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.StartGuide
member.summary: Specifies a length that is added to the length of a start extension line.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.EndGuide
member.summary: Specifies a length that is added to the length of the end extension line.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.Placing
member.summary: Specifies whether the measure line is rendered below or above the edge defined by the two reference points. The defined values are: - above: measure line is rendered above the edge defined by two reference points. - below: measure line is rendered below the edge defined by two reference points.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.IsParallel
member.summary: Specifies whether a measure text is displayed parallel to its measure line or perpendicular to it.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.MeasureHorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the horizontal alignment of a measure text relative to its measure line. The defined values are: - automatic: horizontal alignment of a measure text relative to its measure line is chosen by the consumer. - inside: horizontal alignment of a measure text should be inside relative to its measure line. - left-outside: horizontal alignment of a measure text should be left-outside relative to its measure line. - right-outside: horizontal alignment of a measure text should be right-outside relative to its measure line.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.MeasureVerticalAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the vertical alignment of a measure text relative to its measure line.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.MeasureUnit
member.summary: Specifies the unit of measurement used in the textual presentation of a measure shape.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.ShowMeasureUnit
member.summary: Specifies the visibility of a unit in the textual presentation of a measure shape.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.DecimalPlaces
member.summary: Specifies the number of decimal places that are used for the measure text.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.CaptionType
member.summary: Specifies the geometry of the line of a caption.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.CaptionAngleType
member.summary: Specifies if the escape angle of the line of a caption is fixed or free. The defined values for are: - fixed: escape angle of line from caption has been specified by a draw:caption-angle attribute. - free: consumer can choose the best possible escape angle of the line from a caption.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.CaptionAngle
member.summary: Specifies the escape angle of the line of a caption.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.CaptionGap
member.summary: Specifies the distance between the text area of the caption and the start of the line.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.CaptionEscapeDirection
member.summary: Specifies the escape direction for the line of a caption. If this is set to auto the consumer can choose the best direction. The defined values for the draw:caption-escape-direction attribute are: - auto: consumer should choose best escape direction for a line of a caption. - horizontal: the escape line of a caption should be drawn horizontally. - vertical: the escape line of a caption should be drawn vertically.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.CaptionEscape
member.summary: Specifies the escape point of the caption line measured from the top left corner of the text area.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.CaptionLineLength
member.summary: Specifies the length of the first line of a caption.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.CaptionFitLineLength
member.summary: Specifies the consumer to determine the best possible length for a caption line.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.RunThrough
member.summary: Specifies whether content of a frame is displayed in the background or foreground. The value of this attribute can be foreground or background. The defined values are: - background: frame content is displayed behind a text. - foreground: frame content is displayed in front of a text.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.WrappedParagraphCount
member.summary: Specifies the number of paragraphs that can wrap around a frame if the anchor position of a frame or drawing shape is a paragraph or a character, and the wrap mode specified by the wrap is left, right, parallel, or dynamic

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.Mirror
member.summary: Specifies whether an image is mirrored before it is displayed. The mirroring can be vertical or horizontal or both. The defined values for are: - none: image should not be mirrored before being displayed. - horizontal: image should be mirrored horizontally before being displayed. - horizontal-on-even: image should be mirrored horizontally on even numbered pages before being displayed. - horizontal-on-odd: image should be mirrored horizontally on odd numbered pages before being displayed. - vertical: image should be mirrored vertically before being displayed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.Protect
member.summary: Specifies whether the content, size, or position of a frame is protected. The value of this attribute can be either none or a white space separated list that consists of any of the values content, position, or size. The defined values for the style:protect attribute are: - content: content of a frame should be protected from editing. - none: the content, size and position of a frame should be subject to editing. - position: the position of a frame should be protected from editing. - size: the size of a frame should be protected from editing.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.WrapInfluenceOnPosition
member.summary: Specifies how the wrapping mode influences the positioning of a frame.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GraphicProperties.BackgroundTransparency
member.summary: Specifies the transparency of a paragraph's background color.

member.summary: Specifies the writing mode.

member.summary: Specifies the type of a button. The defined values are: -push: pressing the button does not perform any action by default. A user can add scripts to a button and the script will run when the button is pressed. -reset: pressing the button resets every control in the form to its default value. -submit: pressing the button submits the form. -url: pressing the button loads the URL that is specified in the xlink:href attribute. The default value for this attribute is push.

member.summary: Locates a remote resource.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Button.ImagePosition
member.summary: Specifies the location of an image relative to the text of a control. The defined values are: - bottom: image is placed below the text. - center: image centered relative to the text. - end: image is placed after the text. - start: image is placed before the text. - top: image is placed above the text. The default value for this attribute is center.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.Button.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Specifies which border (start, end) or axis (center) of an image and a text are to be aligned. The defined values are: -center: image and text are centered. -end: image and text are aligned on the end of the image. -start: image and text are aligned on the start of the image. If a form:image-align attribute is not present, it is assumed to be center. The default value for this attribute is center.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RotationAlignment
member.summary: Represents how the edge of the text in a cell is aligned after a rotation.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RotationAlignment.Bottom
member.summary: Text is rotated and may overlap with other cells if the text is longer than the length of the cell.Borders and background are positioned parallel to the text, whereby the edge that is named by the attribute value aligns with the corresponding edge of the cell's original position.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RotationAlignment.Top
member.summary: Text is rotated and may overlap with other cells if the text is longer than the length of the cell.Borders and background are positioned parallel to the text, whereby the edge that is named by the attribute value aligns with the corresponding edge of the cell's original position.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RotationAlignment.Center
member.summary: Text is rotated and may overlap with other cells if the text is longer than the length of the cell.Borders and background are positioned parallel to the text, whereby the edge that is named by the attribute value aligns with the corresponding edge of the cell's original position.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RotationAlignment.None
member.summary: Text is rotated and aligned within the cell.Borders and background are unchanged.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.SequenceVariableField.NumberFormat
member.summary: Specifies a numbering sequence. The defined values are: -1: Hindu-Arabic number sequence starts with 1. -a: number sequence of lowercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “a”. -A: number sequence of uppercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “A”. -i: number sequence of lowercase Roman numerals starts with “i”. -I: number sequence of uppercase Roman numerals start with “I”. -a value of type string 18.2. -an empty string: no number sequence displayed. If no value is given, no number sequence is displayed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.SequenceVariableField.EnableLetterSynchronization
member.summary: Specifies whether letter synchronization shall take place. If letters are used in alphabetical order for numbering, there are two ways to process overflows within a digit, as follows: -false: A new digit is inserted that always has the same value as the following digit. The numbering sequence (for lower case numberings) in that case is a, b, c, ..., z, aa, bb, cc, ..., zz, aaa, ..., and so on. -true: A new digit is inserted. Its start value is ”a” or ”A”, and it is incremented every time an overflow occurs in the following digit. The numbering sequence (for lower case numberings) in that case is a,b,c, ..., z, aa, ab, ac, ...,az, ba, ..., and so on.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.SequenceVariableField.ReferenceName
member.summary: Contains the name that is used as a reference.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.SequenceVariableField.Value
member.summary: Contains sequence variable.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.Legend.Align
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of a legend with the plot area. The defined values are: - center: legend is aligned at the center of the plot-area. - end: legend is aligned at the end of the plot-area (which is right or bottom). - start: legend is aligned at the beginning of the plot-area (which is left or top).

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.Legend.Expansion
member.summary: Specifies the direction in which a legend expands while accommodating new entries. The defined values are: - balanced: legend expands horizontally and vertically. - custom: with a style:legend-expansion-aspect-ratio attribute legend expands according to the specified ratio. - high: legend expands vertically. - wide: legend expands horizontally.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.PageNumber.SelectPage
member.summary: Specifies whether to display or not the number of a previous or following page rather than the number of the current page. The defined values are: -current: number of the current page. -next: number of the page immediately following the current page. -previous: number of the page immediately preceding the current page.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.PageNumber.Adjustment
member.summary: Specifies an adjustment of the value of a page number field, in order to display of page numbers of following or preceding pages. The specified value is added to the current page number. If a page with the resulting page number does not exist, no number is displayed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.PageNumber.IsFixed
member.summary: Specifies whether the value of a field element is fixed. The defined values are: -false: value of field element may be replaced with a new value in future edits. -true: value of field element shall be preserved in future edits.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.PageNumber.Value
member.summary: Contains page number.

member.summary: Specifies a numbering sequence. The defined values are: -1: Hindu-Arabic number sequence starts with 1. -a: number sequence of lowercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “a”. -A: number sequence of uppercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “A”. -i: number sequence of lowercase Roman numerals starts with “i”. -I: number sequence of uppercase Roman numerals start with “I”. -a value of type string 18.2. -an empty string: no number sequence displayed. If no value is given, no number sequence is displayed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Scenario class.

member.summary: Creates a new object that is a deep copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

member.summary: Converts the value of the current Scenario object to its equivalent string representation.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.Ranges
member.summary: Contains the table range that is displayed as a scenario. The value of this attribute is a white space separated list of cell range addresses.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.IsActive
member.summary: Specifies whether a scenario that belongs to a scenario table is active. The defined values are: -false: scenario that belongs to a scenario table is inactive. -true: scenario that belongs to a scenario table is active.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.DisplayBorder
member.summary: Specifies whether to display a border around a scenario that belongs to a scenario table. The defined values are: -false: border is not displayed. -true: border is displayed. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.BorderColor
member.summary: Contains a color of a border that is displayed around a scenario that belongs to a scenario table.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.CopyBack
member.summary: Specifies whether data is copied back into a scenario table if another scenario is activated. The defined values are: -false: data is not copied back into a scenario table if another scenario is activated. -true: data copied back into a scenario table if another scenario is activated. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.CopyStyles
member.summary: Specifies whether styles are copied from a scenario table to a destination table together with the data. The defined values are: -false: styles are not copied with data. -true: styles are copied with data. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.CopyFormulas
member.summary: specifies whether formulas are copied from a scenario table to a destination table. The defined values are: -false: only values resulting from formulas are copied. -true: formulas are copied. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.Comment
member.summary: Contains a comment about a scenario.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Scenario.IsProtected
member.summary: Specifies whether the data that is displayed within the scenario is protected from being edited. The attribute is only evaluated if the table on which the scenario displayed is also protected. The defined values for the table:protected attribute are: -false: data is not protected. -true: data is protected.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar
member.summary: Represents the calendar system used to extract parts of a date.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.Gregorian
member.summary: Gregorian calendar with cut-off date 1582-10-04, 1582-10-15 following. Dates before cut-off date are calculated in Julian proleptic calendar [ISO8601].

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.Gengou
member.summary: Japanese Gengou calendar, Emperor eras. Identical to Gregorian calendar but with different eras for each emperor. Consumers may implement only the modern eras starting 1868, Meiji, Taisho, Showa and Heisei. Earlier dates are then displayed using the Gregorian calendar [JIS X 0301].

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.Roc
member.summary: Taiwanese Minguo calendar, identical to Gregorian calendar offset by -1911 years.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.HanjaYoil
member.summary: Legacy alias for hanja.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.Hanja
member.summary: Additional Gregorian calendar in Korean locales, uses differently localized day and month names.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.Hijri
member.summary: Islamic Hijri lunar calendar (religious, non-civil).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.Jewish
member.summary: Jewish lunisolar calendar.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.Buddhist
member.summary: Buddhist calendar, identical to Gregorian calendar but offset by -543 years.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Calendar.None
member.summary: None.

member.summary: Specifies whether axis labels may overlap each other.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.LineBreak
member.summary: Specifies whether word wrapping is allowed for axis labels.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.LabelArrangement
member.summary: Specifies the arrangement of labels on an axis.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.ScaleText
member.summary: Specifies that the text contained in an object should be scaled whenever the size of the chart changes.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.ThreeDimensional
member.summary: Specifies whether axis labels may overlap each other.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Deep
member.summary: Specifies whether data series are displayed behind each other along the z-axis or not.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.AutoPosition
member.summary: Specifies if an object should be positioned automatically.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Logarithmic
member.summary: Specifies whether logarithmic scaling will be used on an axis. By default, proportional scaling is used.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.ReverseDirection
member.summary: Specifies whether the direction of an axis follows the Cartesian coordinate system or the reverse. False is the default.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.AutoSize
member.summary: Specifies if the size of an object should be chosen automatically.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.AxisLabelPosition
member.summary: Specifies the position of the axis labels.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.ConnectBars
member.summary: Specifies if bars in a bar chart that belong to the same series are connected by lines.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.DataLabelNumber
member.summary: Specifies whether the value and/or the percentage of a data point should be displayed within a data label. By default, neither the value nor a percentage is displayed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.DataLabelSymbol
member.summary: Specifies whether to display a legend symbol within the data label of a data point.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.DataLabelText
member.summary: Specifies whether to display the category within the data label of a data point.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Vertical
member.summary: Specifies whether the x-axis in a Cartesian coordinate system is oriented horizontally or vertically.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Visible
member.summary: Specifies if an object in a chart is visible or not. By default, objects are visible.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Stacked
member.summary: Specifies the accumulation of the series values per category. Each value is in addition to the other values in the same category.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Percentage
member.summary: Specifies a percentage accumulation of values per category.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.LabelPosition
member.summary: Specifies where data labels are placed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.LabelPositionNegative
member.summary: Specifies where data negative labels are placed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Maximum
member.summary: Specifies the maximum value of an axis.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Minimum
member.summary: Specifies the minimum value of an axis.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.MeanValue
member.summary: Specifies whether to display a line that represents the statistical mean value of all data points of a series.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Origin
member.summary: Specifies origin of the graphical representation of a data series attached to an axis.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.Overlap
member.summary: Specifies how much bars within the same category in a bar chart overlap. It is specified as an integer percentage relative to the width of a single bar.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.ChartProperties.PieOffset
member.summary: Specifies the distance of a segment from the center of the circle in case of circle charts. The offset is given as percentage of the radius of the circle.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition
member.summary: Represents where data labels are placed.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.AvoidOverlap
member.summary: An algorithm should be used that tries to place the labels without overlapping each other.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.Bottom
member.summary: The data label is placed below the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.BottomLeft
member.summary: The data label is placed to the bottom left of the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.BottomRight
member.summary: The data label is placed to the bottom right of the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.Center
member.summary: The data label is centered on the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.Inside
member.summary: The data label is placed inside the data point ( for pie charts the label is placed inside the piece on the bisecting line aligned to the outer radius, for bar charts the label is inside the bar aligned to that end that is given by the data points value, for polar charts the label is placed on that side of the data point that points to the polar charts center ).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.Left
member.summary: The data label is placed left of the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.NearOrigin
member.summary: The data label is placed inside the data point on that side that is near to the origin - where the origin is the beginning of the bar in a bar chart or the base line in an area chart ( for bar charts the label is placed inside the bar like with value inside, but aligned to the opposite end of the bar ).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.Outside
member.summary: The data label is placed outside the data point ( for pie charts the label is placed outside the circle aligned to the outer radius, for bar charts the label is outside the bar aligned to that end that is given by the data points value, for polar charts the label is placed on that side of the data point that points away from the polar charts center ).

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.Right
member.summary: The data label is placed right of the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.Top
member.summary: The data label is placed on top of the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.TopLeft
member.summary: The data label is placed to the top left of the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.TopRight
member.summary: The data label is placed to the top right of the data point.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LabelPosition.None
member.summary: None.

member.summary: Contains a string that is displayed before a bibliography entry's short name or number if it occurs outside the bibliography.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.BibliographyConfiguration.Suffix
member.summary: Contains a string that is displayed after a bibliography entry's short name or number if it occurs outside the bibliography.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.BibliographyConfiguration.NumberedEntries
member.summary: Specifies whether a number is displayed for bibliography entries instead of their short name. The defined values for the are: -false: short names for bibliographic entries displayed. -true: number displayed for bibliographic entries. The default value for this attribute is false.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.BibliographyConfiguration.SortByPosition
member.summary: Specifies whether bibliography entries are displayed in the order of their positions in the document, or by selected fields. The defined values are: -false: bibliographic entries are displayed in the order of their positions in a document. -true: bibliographic entries are displayed as sorted by selected fields. The default value for this attribute is true.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.BibliographyConfiguration.Language
member.summary: Contains the language code used for sorting an alphabetical index.

member.summary: Contains the country code used for sorting a bibliographic index.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.BibliographyConfiguration.SortAlgorithm
member.summary: Contains a locale specific sorting algorithm by name.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.BibliographyConfiguration.SortKeys
member.summary: Contains a single sort key if bibliography entries are not displayed in document order.

If the attribute appears in an automatic style, it may reference either an automatic text style or a common style. If the attribute appears in a common style, it may reference a common style only.

member.summary: Specifies whether to use normal or italic font face. The defined values are: -italic: characters displayed in an italic font face. -normal: characters displayed in normal font face. -oblique: characters displayed in an oblique font face.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.ComplexFontCharacterSet
member.summary: Specifies whether a font defines glyphs according to the semantics of [UNICODE] or not.It is evaluated for [UNICODE] characters that are complex text layout (CTL) characters.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.FontPitch
member.summary: Specifies whether a font has a fixed or variable width. This attribute is evaluated for any [UNICODE] character other than CJK or complex text layout (CTL) characters. The defined values are: -fixed: font pitch is fixed. -variable: font pitch is variable.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.AsianFontPitch
member.summary: Specifies whether a font has a fixed or variable width. This attribute is evaluated for [UNICODE] characters that are CJK characters. The defined values are: -fixed: font width is fixed. -variable: font width is variable.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.ComplexFontPitch
member.summary: Specifies whether a font has a fixed or variable width. This attribute is evaluated for [UNICODE] characters that are complex text layout (CTL) characters. The defined values are: -fixed: font width is fixed. -variable: font width is variable.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.FontFamily
member.summary: Specifies the font family for a text.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.AsianFontFamily
member.summary: Specifies the font family for a text.It is evaluated for [UNICODE] characters that are CJK characters.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.ComplexFontFamily
member.summary: Specifies the font family for a text.This attribute is evaluated for [UNICODE] characters that are complex text layout (CTL) characters.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.FontWeight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of a font.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.AsianFontWeight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of a font.It is evaluated for [UNICODE] characters that are CJK characters.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.ComplexFontWeight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of a font.It is evaluated for [UNICODE] characters that are complex text layout (CTL) characters.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.GenericFontFamily
member.summary: Specifies a generic font family name.This attribute is evaluated for any [UNICODE] character other than CJK or complex text layout (CTL) characters. The defined values are: -decorative: the family of decorative fonts. -modern: the family of modern fonts. -roman: the family roman fonts (with serifs). -script: the family of script fonts. -swiss: the family roman fonts (without serifs). -system: the family system fonts.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.AsianGenericFontFamily
member.summary: Specifies a generic Asian font family name.It is evaluated for [UNICODE] characters that are CJK characters. The defined values are: -decorative: the family of decorative fonts. -modern: the family of modern fonts. -roman: the family roman fonts (with serifs). -script: the family of script fonts. -swiss: the family roman fonts (without serifs). -system: the family system fonts.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.ComplexGenericFontFamily
member.summary: Specifies a generic font family name. The defined values are: -decorative: the family of decorative fonts. -modern: the family of modern fonts. -roman: the family roman fonts (with serifs). -script: the family of script fonts. -swiss: the family roman fonts (without serifs). -system: the family system fonts.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.FontStyleType
member.summary: Specifies a font style type.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.AsianFontStyleType
member.summary: Specifies a font asian style type.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.ComplexFontStyleType
member.summary: Specifies a font complex style type.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.BackgroundColor
member.summary: Specifies a background color for text sections. This can be transparent or a color.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.Shadow
member.summary: Specifies the text shadow style to use.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.ScriptType
member.summary: Specifies the script type. The attribute is evaluated for any [UNICODE] characters that are not CJK or complex text layout (CTL) characters.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.FontRelief
member.summary: Specifies whether a font should be embossed, engraved, or neither. The defined values are: -embossed: characters are embossed. -engraved: characters are engraved. -none: characters are neither embossed or engraved.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.UnderlineType
member.summary: Specifies the type of underlining applied to a text. The defined values are: -double: a double line should be used for underlining applied to a text. -none: deprecated. -single: a single line should be used for underlining applied to a text.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.UnderlineStyle
member.summary: Specifies a style for underlining text. The defined values are: -none: text has no underlining. -dash: text has a dashed line underlining it. -dot-dash: text has a line whose repeating pattern is a dot followed by a dash underlining it. -dot-dot-dash: text has a line whose repeating pattern is two dots followed by a dash underlining it. -dotted: text has a dotted line underlining it. -long-dash: text has a dashed line whose dashes are longer than the ones from the dashed line for value dash underlining it. -solid: text has a solid line underlining it. -wave: text has a wavy line underlining it.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.UnderlineWordMode
member.summary: Specifies whether underlining is applied to words only or to portions of text. If underlining is applied to text portions, the spaces between words and the words are underlined. The defined values are: -continuous: underlining is applied to words and separating spaces. -skip-white-space: underlining is not applied to spaces between words.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.UnderlineWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width of an underline. The value bold specifies a line width that is calculated from the font sizes like an auto width, but is wider than an auto width. The defined values are: -auto: the width of an underline should be calculated from the font size of the text where the underline will appear. -bold: the width of an underline should be calculated from the font size of the text where the underline will appear but is wider than for the value of auto. -a value of type percent -a value of type positive integer -a value of type positive length

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.UnderlineColor
member.summary: Specifies a color that is used to underline text. The value of this attribute is either font-color or a color. The defined values are: -font-color: the current text color is used for underlining. -a value of type color: the color to be used for underlining.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.LineThroughWordMode
member.summary: Specifies whether lining through is applied to words only or to portions of text. The defined values are: -continuous: lining is applied to words and separating spaces. -skip-white-space: lining is not applied to spaces between words.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.EnableLetterKerning
member.summary: Specifies whether kerning between characters is enabled or disabled.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.EnableTextBlinking
member.summary: Specifies whether text blinks.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.TextCombine
member.summary: Specifies whether to combine characters so that they are displayed within two lines. The defined values are: -letters: Display text in Kumimoji. Up to five (5) characters are combined within two lines and are displayed with a reduced size in a single wide-cell character. Additional characters are displayed as normal text. -lines: Displays text in Warichu. All characters with the style:text-combine attribute that immediately follow each other are displayed within two lines of approximately the same length. A line break may occur between any two characters to meet this constraint. -none: characters should not be combined.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.TextCombineStartChar
member.summary: Specifies the start character that is displayed before a portion of text

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.TextCombineEndChar
member.summary: Specifies the end character that is displayed after a portion of text

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.TextRotationAngle
member.summary: Specifies an angle to which text is rotated.If more than one character is selected, the entire selection is rotated as a block. The defined values for are: -0 degrees -90 degrees -270 degrees -an angle. The value shall be one of 0deg, 90deg or 270deg, or any of its equivalents in rad or grad.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.TextRotationScale
member.summary: Specifies whether for rotated text the width of the text should be scaled to fit into the current line height or the width of the text should remain fixed, therefore changing the current line height. The defined values for are: -fixed: width of text should remain fixed. -line-height: width of text should be scaled to fit the current line height.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.LetterSpacing
member.summary: Specifies the spacing between letters.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.DefaultTextStyle.TextScale
member.summary: Specifies the text scale.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.CharacterCount.NumberFormat
member.summary: Specifies a numbering sequence. The defined values are: - 1: Hindu-Arabic number sequence starts with 1. - a: number sequence of lowercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “a”. - A: number sequence of uppercase Modern Latin basic alphabet characters starts with “A”. - i: number sequence of lowercase Roman numerals starts with “i”. - I: number sequence of uppercase Roman numerals start with “I”. - a value of type string 18.2. - an empty string: no number sequence displayed. If no value is given, no number sequence is displayed.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.CharacterCount.Value
member.summary: Contains a number of characters that an OpenDocument producer has counted for a document.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.WrapContourMode
member.summary: Represents the nature of the wrapping of text around the contour of a shape.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.WrapContourMode.Full
member.summary: Text wraps around the shape and fills any spaces and indentations in the shape.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.WrapContourMode.Outside
member.summary: Text wraps around the general area to the left and right of the shape.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.WrapContourMode.None
member.summary: None

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GradientStyle
member.summary: Represents a rendering for a gradient.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GradientStyle.Linear
member.summary: Defines a gradient where the colors blend along a linear vector perpendicular to the axis of the gradient.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GradientStyle.Axial
member.summary: Defines a bi-linear gradient that is also known as reflected gradient or mirrored linear gradient. It is created as a linear gradient that is mirrored (or reflected) along its axis.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GradientStyle.Radial
member.summary: Defines a gradient where the colors are blend along the radius from the center of a circle. The outside of the circle is filled with the end color.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GradientStyle.Ellipsoid
member.summary: Defines a gradient where the colors are blend along the radius from the center of an ellipsoid. The length of the semi major axis is the width of the filled area and the length of the semi minor axis is the height of the filled area. The area outside the ellipse is filled with the end color.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GradientStyle.Square
member.summary: Defines a gradient that produces a square blend, imitating the visual perspective in a corridor or the aerial view of a pyramid. Also known as "box gradient" and "pyramidal gradient".

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GradientStyle.Rectangular
member.summary: Defines a gradient that produces a rectangular blend from the center of the rectangle to the shortest of the 4 borders. The center of the rectangle is defined with the attributes draw:cx and draw:cy. The width of the rectangle is the width of the filled area, the height of the rectangle is the height of the filled area. The outside of the square is filled with the end color.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.GradientStyle.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RubyAlignment
member.summary: Represents the horizontal alignment of the ruby text in relationship to the ruby base.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RubyAlignment.Left
member.summary: ruby text to the left of ruby base text.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RubyAlignment.Center
member.summary: ruby text centered on ruby base text.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RubyAlignment.Right
member.summary: ruby text to the right of ruby base text.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RubyAlignment.DistributeLetter
member.summary: If the width of the ruby text is smaller than that of the ruby base text, then the ruby text contents are evenly distributed across the width of the ruby base text, with the first and last ruby text glyphs lining up with the corresponding first and last base glyphs. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the ruby base text, then the letters of the ruby base text are evenly distributed across the width of the ruby text.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.RubyAlignment.DistributeSpace
member.summary: If the width of the ruby text is smaller than that of the ruby base text, then the ruby text contents are evenly distributed across the width of the ruby base text, with a certain amount of white space preceding the first and following the last character in the ruby text. That amount of white space is normally equal to half the amount of inter-character space of the ruby text. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the ruby base text, then the same type of space distribution applies to the ruby base text. In other words, if the base is shorter than the ruby text, the base is distribute-space aligned.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.PrintPageOrder
member.summary: Represents the order in which data in a spreadsheet is numbered and printed when the data does not fit on one printed page.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.PrintPageOrder.TopToBottom

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType
member.summary: Represents a chart type.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Line
member.summary: The values are interpreted as y-coordinates within a Cartesian coordinate system with horizontal x-axis and vertical y-axis.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Area
member.summary: The values are interpreted as y-coordinates within a Cartesian coordinate system with horizontal x-axis and vertical y-axis. The accessory x-coordinates are generated from the positions in the y-value sequence starting with 1.0. The first y value gets an x value 1.0. The second y value is associated with an x value of 2.0 and so forth.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Circle
member.summary: The values are displayed as pie chart.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Ring
member.summary: The values are displayed as one ring in a donut chart.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Scatter
member.summary: The values are interpreted as y-coordinates within a Cartesian coordinate system with horizontal x-axis and vertical y-axis.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Radar
member.summary: The values are interpreted as radius-coordinates within a counter clockwise polar coordinate system.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Bar
member.summary: The values are interpreted as y-coordinates within a Cartesian coordinate system with horizontal x-axis and vertical y-axis. The accessory x-coordinates are generated from the positions in the y-value sequence starting with 1.0. The first y value gets an x value 1.0. The second y value is associated with an x value of 2.0 and so forth.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Stock
member.summary: The values are interpreted together to form the opening, minimum, maximum and closing (in this order) values of a stock symbol displayed at the y scale in a Cartesian coordinate system with horizontal x-axis and vertical y-axis. If only three series are given, the values are interpreted as minimum, maximum and closing values (in this order). The accessory x-coordinates are generated from the positions in the y-value sequence starting with 1.0. The first y value gets an x value 1.0. The second y value is associated with an x value of 2.0 and so forth.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Surface
member.summary: The values are interpreted as altitudes at specific grid locations.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Charts.ChartType.Gantt
member.summary: The values are interpreted together to form the start and end values (in this order) in a gantt chart. Start and end values are displayed at the y-axis in a Cartesian coordinate system with horizontal x-axis and vertical y-axis. The accessory x-coordinates are generated from the positions in the y-value sequence starting with 1.0. The first y value gets an x value 1.0. The second y value is associated with an x value of 2.0 and so forth.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.SequenceVariableDeclaration
member.summary: Represents declare sequence variables used to number items within an OpenDocument text document.Sequence variables are commonly used for sequential numbering. However, expression formulas can be included in sequence fields to support more advanced sequences.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the SequenceVariableDeclaration class.

member.summary: Converts the value of the current SequenceVariableDeclaration object to its equivalent string representation.

member.summary: Contains a unique name of a variable to be declared.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.SequenceVariableDeclaration.OutlineLevel
member.summary: Specifies the numbering of a sequence by chapter. This attribute specifies an outline level that determines which chapters to reference for the chapter-specific numbering. All chapters that are at or below the specified outline level reset the value of the sequence to zero, the default value. The chapter number of the last chapter at or below the specified outline level is prefixed to the sequence number. Choosing an outline level of zero results in a straight sequence of all sequence elements for that sequence variable.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Fields.SequenceVariableDeclaration.SeparationCharacter
member.summary: Specifies the character used to separate values representing levels in an outline.

member.summary: If a user presses the TAB key in the last control of the form, the focus moves to the first control specified in the tab order of the same form.

member.summary: If a user presses the TAB key in the last control of the form, the focus moves to the first control specified in the tab order of the same form.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.TabCycle.Page
member.summary: If a user presses the TAB key in the last control of a form, the focus moves to the first control specified in the tab order for the next form.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.TabCycle.None
member.summary: None.

member.summary: Specifies the name of a hatch style.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Hatch.Style
member.summary: Specifies a rendering for a hatch. The defined values for the draw:style attribute are: -double, defines a hatch that is made of a set of parallel lines along the axis of the hatch and a set of parallel lines perpendicular to the axis of the hatch. -single, defines a hatch that is made of parallel lines along the axis of the hatch. -triple, defines a hatch that is made of a set of parallel lines along the axis of the hatch, a set of parallel lines perpendicular to the axis of the hatch and a set of lines along 45 degree clockwise to the axis of the hatch.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Hatch.Color
member.summary: Specifies the color of hatch lines.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Hatch.Distance
member.summary: Specifies the distance between two hatch lines.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.Hatch.Angle
member.summary: Specifies the rotation angle of hatch lines.

If no value is given, no number sequence is displayed.

member.name: T:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LayoutGridMode
member.summary: Enables Asian layout grids.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LayoutGridMode.Line
member.summary: Enables a line layout, this is, the page is divided in a fixed number of lines. The exact number of lines depends on the other layout grid formatting properties. There is no space between the layout grid lines. The layout grid itself is centered on the page.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LayoutGridMode.Both
member.summary: Like lines, except that the lines are divided into rectangular layout cells. Within a layout cell, no more than one Asian [UNICODE] character is displayed. An Asian character that does not fit into a single layout cell is displayed centered into as many layout cells as required. Non Asian text is centered within as many cells as required.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.LayoutGridMode.None
member.summary: None.

member.summary: Specifies a value that restarts numbering at the current heading.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Heading.IsListHeader
member.summary: Specifies the appearance of a specific heading without numbering.The defined values for the text:is-list-header attribute are: - false: heading will be numbered. - true: heading will be not numbered, even if an explicit list-style is given. The default value for this attribute is false.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Heading.Style
member.summary: Specifies a style that shall have the family paragraph. If a conditional style is applied, this attribute has the name of the style that was the result of the conditional style evaluation.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Heading.Number
member.summary: Contains the text of a formatted number which is present when a list style is applied to an element whose corresponding list level style specifies that the list label is a number. This text may be used by consumers that do not support the automatic generation of numbering but should be ignored by consumers that do support it.

member.summary: Contains a text style.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.LineNumberingConfiguration.Increment
member.summary: Contains a line numbers to be numbered as multiples of a specified increment.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.LineNumberingConfiguration.Position
member.summary: Contains a margin where line numbers appear.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.LineNumberingConfiguration.Offset
member.summary: Contains a distance between a line number and the margin.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.LineNumberingConfiguration.CountEmptyLines
member.summary: Specifies whether empty lines are included in the line count. The defined values for the attribute are: -false: empty lines are not included in a line count. -true: empty lines are included in a line count. The default value for this attribute is true.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.LineNumberingConfiguration.CountLinesInTextBoxes
member.summary: Specifies whether text in text boxes is included in the line count. If the value of this attribute is true, text within text boxes is included in the line count. The defined values for the text:count-in-text-boxes attribute are: -false: text within text boxes is not included in a line count. -true: text within text boxes is included in a line count. The default value for this attribute is false.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.LineNumberingConfiguration.RestartOnPage
member.summary: Specifies whether the line count is reset to 1 at the start of every page. The defined values for the text:restart-on-page attribute are: -false: line count is not reset, resulting in document-specific numbering of lines. -true: line count is reset to 1 at the beginning of every page, resulting in page-specific line numbering. The default value for this attribute is false.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.LineNumberingConfiguration.Separator
member.summary: Contains the text that is displayed as a separator. A separator is text that is displayed instead of a line number for lines where no number is displayed.

member.summary: Specifies how the intersecting areas of objects contained in a drawing and grafic are combined to form the area.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.FillRule.NonZero
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments within the given shape that the ray crosses. If this number is odd, the point is inside; if even, the point is outside.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.FillRule.EvenOdd
member.summary: Rule that determines whether a point is in the fill region of the path by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.

member.name: F:Independentsoft.Odf.Styles.FillRule.None
member.summary: None.

member.summary: Specifies the default value of an input control.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.IsDisabled
member.summary: Specifies whether a control can accept user input.Controls that are disabled are not included in the tabbing navigation sequence and cannot be focused.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.IsPrintable
member.summary: Specifies whether a control is printed when a user prints a document in which the control is contained.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.TabIndex
member.summary: Contains tabbing navigation order of controls within a form.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.EnableTabbingNavigation
member.summary: Specifies whether a control is included in the tabbing navigation order.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.Title
member.summary: Contains additional information about a control. The value of the attribute can be used as a tool tip.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.DataField
member.summary: Specifies the name of a column in the result set defined by a (data-aware) form. A control interchanges content with its column when: -the current row of a form changes, the control is initialized with the value from its column. -the user changes the content of a control, this changed value is written back to its column.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.IsCurrentSelected
member.summary: Specifies the state of a radio button or option element.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.IsSelected
member.summary: Specifies the default state of a radio button or option. A control initializes to the default state specified by this attribute.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.Label
member.summary: Specifies the text for a control.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.VisualEfect
member.summary: Specifies a visual affect to apply to a control. The defined values are: -3d: 3D visual effect. -flat: flat visual effect.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.ImagePosition
member.summary: Specifies the location of an image relative to the text of a control. The defined values are: -bottom: image is placed below the text. -center: image centered relative to the text. -end: image is placed after the text. -start: image is placed before the text. -top: image is placed above the text. The default value for this attribute is center.

member.name: P:Independentsoft.Odf.Forms.RadioButton.ImageAlignment
member.summary: Specifies which border (start, end) or axis (center) of an image and a text are to be aligned. The defined values are: -center: image and text are centered. -end: image and text are aligned on the end of the image. -start: image and text are aligned on the start of the image. If a form:image-align attribute is not present, it is assumed to be center. The default value for this attribute is center.
